company.caretaker

Class TaskManMemento

  • java.lang.Object
    • company.caretaker.TaskManMemento

  • public class TaskManMemento
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a system memento. These mementos contain data representing the system at a specific moment in time. The TaskManCaretaker can choose to discard these mementos if no longer needed, or order them to revert the system to the state stored in the specific memento.
    Author:
    Tim Van Den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskManMemento

        public TaskManMemento(java.lang.String taskmanToSave,
                      ResourceView currentUserLoggedIn,
                      java.time.LocalDateTime currentSystemTime,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,OriginalTaskProxy> originalTaskProxy,
                      java.util.List<DelegatedTaskMemento> delegatedTasks)
        Construct a memento with a string representation of the system, a user (the current user), the time and maps and mementos containing data for re-linking proxies
        Parameters:
        taskmanToSave - | The string representation of the system, comparable to the TMAN files used at initialization
        currentUserLoggedIn - | The user logged in the system when the memento was saved
        currentSystemTime - | The time when the memento was saved
        originalTaskProxy - | A map linking delegating tasks to their respective proxies
        delegatedTasks - | A data structure linking delegated tasks with their respective proxies

    • Method Detail

      • revert

        public void revert(BranchManager branchManager)
        Revert the branch to the last memento save.
        Parameters:
        branchManager - The BranchManager linked with the branch to revert.
